issue.title: nuspec for linux platform
issue.body:
general nuspec file contains wrong paths, wrong set of files (which includes PCL), and don't include $configuration$ in pathnames.

To package this file, one may use
nuget pack "nuget/nunit.linux.nuspec" -Properties version=3.0.0 -Properties configuration=Debug -BasePath .
from the root directory

issue.title: Req: Ebuilds for NUnit 2.6.4 and 3.0.0
issue.body:
2 versions are required because of breaking changes

https://github.com/nunit/nunit/pull/758

issue.title: Msbuild fixes
issue.body:
This pull request fixes two issues with the build and partially fixes one other:

Fixes #642 It turns out not to be possible to split the script into multiple imported files due to a bug in Mono xbuild. Instead, I have added Region directives, which make it a bit easier to find specific targets provided the necessary extension is installed in the IDE.  Since this seems to be as far as we can go on the issue, we can close it once we merge this.

Fixes #649 We now use a community task to zip binaries, rather than git. We still use Git to zip up the source.
#760 Source and zip files are built on Linux now. NuGet packages are skipped due to an error that was arising. Work will continue on this issue in a separate branch after we make some decisions about what packages should be built.

issue.title: Package separately for Silverlight
issue.body:
Based on some discussions around issue #760, we will remove Silverlight from the zip and nuget distributions and create separate packages. For now at least, we will leave it in the msi, since that is only produced on Windows machines.

Tasks:
1. Remove Silverlight from the binary NUnit zip package.
2. Remove Silverlight from the NUnit nuget package.
3. Remove Silverlight from the NUnitLite nuget package.
4. Create a binary zip with just silverlight.
5. Create a Silverlight NUnit nuget package.
6. Create a Silverlight NUnitLite nuget package.

Naming: we will use nunit.silverlight in the package names.

Future: At some point in the (relatively near) future, we will freeze these packages and stop issuing them. At that point, we can remove silverlight from the msi as well.

issue.title: Build Portable Framework on Linux
issue.body:
## Updated Issue

Add portable framework to the Linux solution and document how to build it.
## Original Issue

Based on some discussions around issue #760, we will remove the portable build from the zip and nuget distributions and create separate packages. For now at least, we will leave it in the msi, since that is only produced on Windows machines.

Tasks:
1. Remove portable build from the binary NUnit zip package.
2. Remove portable build from the NUnit nuget package.
3. Remove portable build from the NUnitLite nuget package.
4. Create a binary zip with just the portable build.
5. Create a portable NUnit nuget package.
6. Create a portable NUnitLite nuget package.

Naming: we will use nunit.portable in the package names.

Future: At some point in the (relatively near) future, we will freeze these packages and stop issuing them. At that point, we can remove silverlight from the msi as well.

issue.title: Release beta 4
issue.body: Putting this up for review as I package beta 4. Assuming all is good, I will merge once the beta 4 release is ready, but in the meantime, please review. Mainly packaging details, plus fixed build warnings.
